title: Buckman House Share
postBody:
Buckman area of SE Portland (a.k.a. Lower Hawthorne) that has two rooms coming available for rent on January 15th. The sum total of roommates is 6 when fully occupied, but there are 3 bathrooms, and LOADS of space. The house was built in 1908, and is an old classic foursquare. This house is huge.The house is over 5000 sq feet, and was originally built as a rooming house.
No, not kidding. Huge.
Enjoy your own room and common space galore! There is a full dining room, living room, TV room, and two sun porches. The backyard is small, but fenced, with a small BBQ pit. Off street parking, and plenty of room for bikes.
VERY IMPORTANT
This house is for sale, although off the market for the month of January. Showings will resume in February. Although it may be sold to an investor, who would likely keep all tenants, a family interested in the house have the right to give you 60 days notice if they choose to occupy the house after a sale. Just sayin'
Moving on...
Both rooms are a good size on the 2nd floor, one is probably 'nicer' than the other, but both have wood floors and sunny windows. If you prefer one over the other, you might want to get in first....or you'll just have to duke it out. There are three bedrooms on this floor of the house, and share one large bath with shower and clawfoot tub. There are two more bathrooms in the house on other floors (okay, technically, there are four baths total, but for your purposes, there are three)
Another dog is up for discussion (apparently cats and dachshunds don't get on?) At this time, I am only renting for one person per room, to keep the house #s in balance. If you are a couple and want both rooms, have at it, no discounts.
*We are particularly looking for CLEAN habits on this round.
No, not chore wheels, just identifying areas needing attendance and what I like to refer to as 'after clean' Did you make a mess? Clean it the f@$* up.

Enjoy the community and sustainability of shared living. Utilities are shared on a point system for gas and electric (about $50/60 a month) everything else including wireless internet is included. Washer and dryer are on the 1st floor (as well as the kitchen)

Please contact me with some information about your situation, and I will arrange something with the current tenants so you can meet and see the house.
I will try to respond to all inquiries, because I know things are tight and competitive, but I am only the first and last gatekeeper, you've still got to appeal to the members of the house.
Some short facts:
No smoking of any product tobacco or otherwise in the house.
Month-to-month agreements, first month and one months deposit to secure the room. (all deposits must clear prior to move in).
The four-legged guardian of the house is a middle-aged dachshund, but is known to get on with others
Carnivore-friendly
Vegan-friendly
LGBT friendly
Oh, and anyone practicing for their next dictatorship should look elsewhere.

title: *** HOME AT LAST: Private 2 Bedroom Suite ***

YOU HAVE FOUND YOUR HOME AT LAST!

Thanks for your interest - I look forward to hearing from you!

title: Seniors Coop/Commune
postBody:
The location is yet to be determined but seeking fairly close in \SW side. I tried to post this on Meet Up but that didn't work, then tried the Srs section of CL and clearly lots of mentally ill people chatting there, so will try again here.

I am working on building a very friendly shared housing arrangement for seniors. One where we would rent a house for low cost but in good, clean, nice area and by transport. The object is to provide an environment where we help each other instead of relying on family (whose often not available), and the massive bureaucracy, including care providers that's steal, don't like their job or are squatters. I figure if like 5 or so of us got together and helped each other, i.e. my bad day is your good day, etc as well as providing companionship through the challenges of aging, it could be a way good thing. To make it better would be to have at least one bedrm shared so rent is lower.
I do feel there needs to be requirements though, as clearly mental illness is pretty rampant and if not that, then just people who don't have a clue as to what it takes to share space with others in a peaceful and constructive manners. We can discuss the rules too, but for now they are;
1. Must not have mental health issues, (intermittent brain fog or moodiness is ok)
2. Must be able to discuss any issues without arguing or fighting
3. Must be intelligent with good sense of humor and into constructive things
4. Must be cat and smoker tolerant (ie smells on clothing etc as smoking will be outside)

Im working on being able to obtain housing that will cost ea person approx $200 for rent and then their share of utilities/intenet/tv (hence I reflect $250 which maybe a little off but not much, I don't think).

If interested let me know. Once I have connected with like 7 people I will set an initial meeting downtown (convenient to all) where we can meet and chat. Then I think we should all meet say 5 times so we have a good sense of each other. Maybe meeting at each others current residence if workable.

Look forward to hearing from you.

title: Eco Friendly Living for Women
postBody:
Kailash Ecovillage is a sustainably based intentional community with plenty of garden space and bike parking. This is shared housing for earth friendly Women. Would you like to live with others who share your passion for the environment? Have you ever wanted to live in an intentional community? Then you will love this great housing option. Our apartment complex has just remodeled one of our units to be shared housing with lovely bamboo flooring and granite counter tops. It is close to Reed College and also very easy to get to PSU by bike or bus. Everyone in our community has been selected for their dedication to recycling, composting and sustainability. We have around an acre of vegetable gardens!

A private bedroom and bathroom, shared kitchen and dining with one other woman. 12-month lease.

If you have an interest in viewing our sustainable living property then please send us a quick email about your experience with sustainable living and we can set up a tour date for you. Rent is $695 per month plus utilities.

Note: Non Smokers Only, No Pets

title: Space Available in Furnished Home
postBody:
Centrally located, this Condo is only blocks from Portland State University. Enjoy Life in a secure, newly renovated building. Take a short walk to Waterfront Park, shop Pioneer Place, browse the Farmers, or Saturday Markets. Dine at any number of fabulous restaurants and bars centrally located or hop on the street car or MAX, both are right at your front door for a quick ride to anywhere else your heart desires!

With just under a thousand square feet this fully furnished condo will meet all your Entertaining needs, with tasteful furniture, internet/WiFi, phone, gaming console, and a PC based home theater solution.

The unit has a covered patio & BBQ, wood floors, Berber carpet, stainless steel appliances, granite counters, and access to free laundry, pool, spa, and sauna. Enjoy great views of the South Waterfront to the West Hills and City Lights. The place is a fully equipped with all the gadgets, cooking or multimedia. All the dishes, utensils and a fully stocked pantry with everything you need to dine-in.


RATES & PRICES Negotiable based on Length & Use of Property

Nightly, Weekend, Weekly, or Extended Stay Negotiable


* Spectacular Southern and Western Views
* Just under <1000 sq ft w/ BBQ & Balcony.
* Great downtown location, close to PSU, OHSU.
* Walk to Shops, Waterfront, Keller Auditorium, Restaurants and much More
* All appliances, offices, household supplies and anything else upon request
* Price Includes all utilities, including electric, water, garbage, security, cable, high speed internet
* Queen Size Canopy Bed & Dresser and all furniture possible
* All linens, towels & household goods
* Portland Streetcar & Max located next to building
* Secured Underground Parking Available
* No Smoking on the Property/Building Rule

Please Reply via email with a contact email & #, some details about yourself, reason & dates for your stay.

Please include a price range for the length of time you'd expect to stay/pay.

Please understand it is hard to value something you haven't seen, but once you've seen the place, I assure you it is worth the price you pay.



Other listings do not compare... but if you want to check out how others market the property:

title: Room in cozy St. John's home for Young professional/student
postBody:
Hey there!

We are looking for a student/young professional to rent our spare bedroom starting in the month of January. We are just a few blocks from downtown St. John's where you can find many restaurants, bars, coffee shops, and boutiques. We are really close to Columbia Blvd for easy access to I-5 or 84. You can go over the St. John's bridge and get on hwy 30 or head on Germantown road to get to Beaverton/Hillsboro. Todd and I both work in Vancouver and it's only a 15 min drive. If you'd like to be close to the university of Portland we are just a 5min drive away.

Here is a little about us! Todd is a school counselor and I'm a teacher. (My name is Erin) Todd is 31 and I am 28. We are super active. We are just getting into white water kayaking which has been really fun. We're both from the Midwest and grew up going to lakes in the summer but neither of us had really been around rivers much. Todd snowboards and I like to ski. We both love to drink beer :) We are friendly, fun loving people. We have a cuddle monster of a dog named Angus. Unfortunately Angus has hip dysplasia so we can't accept any more animals. We are clean people but we understand that life happens. I have an extra bed that could be used for a bit if needed but we'd like to eventually keep it in the other spare room for guests. Let me know if you're interested!

We are looking for just one person to occupy the room. We've received several inquiries from couples. We feel that with the space we have, one person would be best. We are looking for someone to move in asap.

Give me a call!
show contact info

Take Care,
Erin and Todd

title: Seeking Congenial Housemate - Female
postBody:
ONLY Long-Term Prospects (Over a year).
Share a townhouse centrally-located by the Interstate Bridge. In an idyllic setting, with public transportation at the door and shopping, downtown Vancouver, Clark College, and many amenities within walking distance. . . the living quarters include a bedroom and adjacent full bath for you (your housemate has the 2nd bedroom and bath); washer/dryer upstairs; high ceilings, both floors; expansive front porch and rear patio; and ample common areas (kitchen, dining and living). Townhouse is fully furnished EXCEPT for the bedroom; and deposit is in place (housemate has been residing here for several years). Cleaning chores to be shared!
Cost of lease, all utilities, cable and WIFI is approximately $1550 per month. . . but your share could be subsidized somewhat in exchange for some cooking/cleaning services or even editing services if you have the academic background (your housemate is a writer). Your cost: $500-$750 range.
Other: Prefer no pets but, if an otherwise great compatibility exists, an exception might be made -- it would require, however, a pet deposit. Housemate offer is extended to intellectually and emotionally-mature female in good health; someone with a reasonable education-culture capable of carrying a conversation; a person financially-solvent, AND a spotless [criminal] background.
Your host-housemate: a scholarly, mature gentleman with a successful and long professional background in the community now dedicating the third stage of his life to writing.
If interested, please reply in an extensive manner stating your preferences. . . and describing yourself. If you are in a hurry "to rent a place," your needs and mine are probably incompatible, since my search is for congeniality. . . and finding whether it might exist requires more than just a casual meeting.

3263 SE 178th Ave. Portland, OR 97236

It's a house, about ten minute walk from the #4 bus stop, about 30 minute walk to the Max line. Basement room, about 14' by 12' with it's own toilet.

Washer/dryer, kitchen with dish washer, big back yard.

$306.25/month rent
$56.00/month bills

$365.00 moves you in today!

The House Rules:
-No pets. Sorry. I love animals, but I don't own the house and can't bend this rule.
-Must be 420 friendly. You don't have to smoke, just don't be annoyed by people who do.
-No junkies and ABSOLUTELY NO METH.
-Respect the house/pick up after yourself and be easy to get along with.

The last time I posted this ad I got around 90 texts in three days. I work full time and can't always reply immediately, so please be patient with me. If this ad is still up, then the room is still available.

So, if you like what you read, then shoot me a text!

title: Furnished Room in South Tabor House
postBody:
Furnished room in house in South Tabor. Single mom and four year old son. Private bathroom, (though my son will need to take baths in the bathtub,) wireless internet, between Powell and Division. Walking distance from Mt. Tabor, 7-11, Pizzicato, pho, Rain or Shine coffee, Steakadelphia, and Warner Pacific.

I prefer a student. Someone quiet that won't have a lot of guests. My son sleeps before 8:00, so you would need to be quiet after that.

title: Are you an awesome roommate?
postBody:
The Location:
This gem is downtown, slightly off-center to it all. It's near PSU. When you're hanging out downtown and miss the last bus, it's not that far of a walk.

The Apartment:
There's two bedrooms. But it's small. Like, REALLY small. And there's pretty much no storage. Unless you count the dishwasher. The building has really thin walls and you can hear EVERYTHING from everywhere. Which I guess could be a good thing, if you're into that sort of thing. But the building is locked so it keeps most of the riffraff out, except for the ones which actually live in the building. There's bike storage in the basement and a little laundry room too.

The Situation:
I've been without a roommate for a while, and it's been pretty okay most of the time, except when I find myself talking to the walls. But, oh, the woes of losing your job. So I'm looking for someone to occupy this space with me. The rent is $940 which means YOUR half is $470 (I like mathing). Water is included in that. Heat is also included, and it's steam heat that makes the apartment REALLY hot. The windows stay open pretty much the whole year. The gas for the stove is also included. We pay for internet (currently around $60 total, but I'm open to getting cable or something else), and electric, which ranges around $50 for two people, depending on how good you are at remembering to turn off the lights. Ideally, I'm looking for a move in around February, but that's flexible. It's $45 to apply (I need to check on that). And the deposit is equal to rent ($470). There may be some flexibility with the deposit as well.

You:
A person with minimal baggage, physically and figuratively. (seriously, this place is small.) Not passive-aggressive. Not the type to bring the ENTIRE bar home. Able to pay your share of bills. Able to have some type of pleasant interaction. I'd like to feel comfortable with the person I'm living with, maybe we can grab drinks, dinner, a show, or some other type of entertainment (Holy moley, I now have the need to add that "some other type of entertainment" is not a euphemism. I don't need your "services"). I don't want to feel like I'm living with a stranger. I don't really care if you smoke, as long as it's not inside. 420 friendly. Have common sense AND common courtesy. I don't have any age or height requirements. Mostly just don't be psychotic or a perv.

Pets?
Apparently the building does allow pets. But, like I said, it's really small, and I'm weary of saying yes to pets because I don't feel like it's fair to them. Also, we're on the 2nd floor and the windows really do stay open all the time (unless you are a wizard that can figure out how to maintain a decent temperature in here). That said, I'm all about flexibility and adaptability.

Me:
I'm 31, look like I'm about 19, and act like I'm 64. Which means I don't feel the need to party all weekend every weekend, and I don't particularly like LOUD NOISES, unless we're listening to good music or watching good movies. I'm losing my job in a couple weeks, but don't worry, I can still pay the rent. It just means I get the pleasure of starting the new year with a new job search! I'm sarcastic, and pretty entertaining if I do say so myself. I like(love) listening to music, and would be down for dance parties with you. I'm super passionate about screen printing, and I've got a bunch of equipment currently occupying the free space. I'm finding somewhere else for it, but if you're into designing/printing and would rather have more of a print shop than a living room (a living print room?), that would be totally cool with me, and I'll share my equipment with you.
I'm quiet, and don't have many people over. I'm a good fatty that works out at 24 hour downtown if you need a gym buddy (it's a couple blocks away). I'm vegan, but you don't need to be. Just don't splash your meat juices all over me and we'll be cool.
Ugh, I'm more chill and flexible than this ad would have you believe.

Other random stuff:
I'm more interested in finding the right fit than finding someone fast. I don't have furniture and kind of like it like that, though I've been thinking about making it a little more "homey". I don't own a tv, not because I'm against it. If you have a tv to put in the living room, that's cool. Actually it's really cool, because then I could hook up my retro duo or plug and play pacman and school you in some retro gaming. My two life mantras are: be excellent to each other (aka treat others the way you want to be treated), and pay attention to what's going on around you (aka you're not the only person in the world).

This is getting really long, so maybe you should just write me, tell me about yourself, your hobbies, your schedule, your favorite music and movies, or whatever you want to tell me about and ask any questions you have. Good luck in your search!

postBody:

title: Potential room for rent (queer/trans friendly)
postBody:
Due to unfortunate circumstances, our current roommate situation isn't working out. We've given our roommate until the middle of the month to either find employment or other means to make the rent for next month. We've decided to start looking for other roommates now, just in case that doesn't happen.
We live in a comfortable 2 bedroom apartment, 1 bath, washer, dryer and dishwasher included. Rent is $964 including w/s/g. We pay electricity and internet through PGE and Century Link respectively, and split the bills evenly among everyone. The lease lasts until July, but we're willing to negotiate time commitments.

We are Aspen and Ani, partners of 6 years, we're both 22 and Genderqueer. We have a cat, he's older and hella chill. We are respectful, radical, compassionate, understanding, and we value open communication and honesty. We would like a roommate who is respectful of others and shared spaces, who can pay bills on time and do agreed upon chores without being prompted, and who would be down to hang out occasionally. We're looking for someone Queer identified, or at the very least well educated on queer/trans issues. We're willing to negotiate accommodating a couple, but given this is a smaller apartment, one roommate is preferred. We're 420 friendly and partake often, so let us know if that will be an issue.

If this sounds like a good fit for you, shoot Aspen a text/email! We'd love to meet and chat. Please do not call, as I don't normally answer calls from unknown numbers. Availability for move-in is flexible, just let us know what works best for you. We'd rather not rush into anything, and would love to get to know you before settling everything.

Ani: I work part time at a boarding and grooming business in town, but I'm perpetually looking for my next adventure. When I'm not working I like to spend my time making art, hanging out with friends, listening to music, watching moves/shows and animal videos, and fighting the systems. I'm pretty honest and forward. I like to clean and I keep a tidyish apartment. I'm a pisces, introverted, and I have depression. I'm seeing a therapist, and constantly working to be the best me that I can be.

Aspen: Genderqueer/Transfeminine, Gemini, INTP. I'm currently going to school at PSU, and working as a event tech for PSU and UO Portland. I sing in PSU's A Cappella group, The Green Note, and sing all the time. I'm also a huge tech head, so I play a lot of video games and spend a lot of time on my computer/phone/various devices. If you need some technological troubleshooting, I'm all yours. I'm friendly and love good conversation, whether about social issues, TV/movies, music, technology, and everything in between. I like to laugh, and do so often. I'm also kinda forgetful, but I'm working on it.

title: The S.S. Midwest wants YOU! One bedroom close-in SE
postBody:
Howdy potential roommate!

Are you looking for a clean, funky, convenient household with a googly-eyed cat? Search no more- this could be the winner! Our 4 bedroom 2 bath house is in need of 2 new roommates to move in FEBRUARY 1st. Two of the current roommates will be staying put and we are looking for roomies who want to help make a nice community to live in. Ya' dig?

About Us:
Lady 1- age 28, has lived in the house for the past 4 years, is deeply passionate about glitter, and a graduate student at PSU. Between school, roller derby, work, and shenanigans, I tend to stay pretty busy. I'm friendly with a sense of humor, put nutritional yeast on 95% of my food, and cried the first time I saw The Matrix.

Lady 2- age 20, has lived in the house since August, and a women's studies major at PSU. Outside of school she also works in a chocolate shop and stays busy. Has an awesome sense of funky style and passion for scrambled eggs. Owns multiple David Bowie posters and sews her own dresses!

The Cat- the best thing since sliced bread. Indoor cat, Captain of Snuggling, still mystified by the Laser Mouse, very cross-eyed, sometimes wears a tie.

The House: two-level old Portland house (upstairs and finished attic) with a bathroom on each floor. Lots of cupboards and counter space in the yellow kitchen, fully carpeted, washer and dryer fo' free, large storage area in basement, close to Colonel Sumner park and all the tasty places on Belmont/ Hawthorne, and on the 15 bus line. The living room gets great sunlight and has an attached porch. This room will be fairly empty after 2 current roomies move out, so bonus points if you have a COUCH! We want to make this space a comfortable living spot for people to read, have a friend over, or hang out in- we're not a party house, but enjoy being social. We don't currently have a TV, but would be open to it! The hallways tend to be a bit chilly in the winter time, but electric heating keeps our rooms, kitchen, living room toasty. Also, no more pets please (unless its a fish or caged for you to take care of).

The Room- 10' x 12', 8.5' ceiling, 3 electric outlets, on first floor. Does not have a closet, but you will have ownership over the (close) back stairway landing area. You could easily set up a tension rod for hanging items here, put a chair with reading lamp, extra storage, painting easel, or something of the sort. There is one large ceiling to floor west facing window which keeps the room quiet and warm.

The Numbers- Feb 1st move-in, rent is $461 each and we share utilities (wifi and PGE) ranging from $15-30ish. It's safe to approximate $500 a month. Rent is currently month to month and the landlord will ask us to sign a 6 month lease together once we confirm we can all live well together :) He's a pretty great guy!

YOU- are awesome! We know you're out there.....you can keep your room as messy as you please, but need to respect the communal spaces. Do your dishes, don't leave buckets of slugs laying around, enjoys high fives, be an adult. Pays rent and utilities on time, queer friendly, 420 friendly (very occasionally), and are just friendly in general. We'd prefer a 1 person who is active with their own things in life, but cares about the folks they live with. The kitchen and living room have space for your items- remember, bonus points for that couch!

So what do you think? If you've made it this far and we sound like a good match, let's set something up. Please respond to this email with the name of your favorite restaurant in the subject line so we know you're not a robot. Thanks!

title: Room for rent in lovely home with creative individual
postBody:
Hey there house hunters! My name is Rachelle and I am looking for someone to share my home with. I am a florist and an artist that is spiritually connected with the earth and I'm looking for someone who can foster open communication, enjoy living together as a household, and pay their bills on time. Here's some details:

The house:
It's the upstairs unit of a duplex in SE portland on 41st and Holgate, pretty much super close to woodstock (an awesome up and coming neighborhood!) and easy to transit to Hawthorne, Belmont (about 10 minutes via the bus line two blocks away). It is also two blocks from Trader Joe's. The kitchen/living room are hardwoods and the rest is carpet. There is an awesome balcony overlooking OHSU and a rad city skyline that is great potential for summer hangs. There is a front yard and a fenced in backyard with raised garden beds. The downstairs tenant is a writer lady who loves to kayak and pretty much is really quiet and does her own thing. There is a basement for storage and has a washer/dryer that we share with the other lady (who rarely does laundry). I am halfway through a year long lease that i signed with my previous roommate who decided to move out. There is 6 months left on it. The landlord would be open (and probably stoked) to extend the lease although I do plan to travel this summer. There is plenty of shared space that I am open to redecorating/ideas/furniture (I have a bit, just not a couch). There is one bathroom that is pretty large and has a tub. I get ready in my room a lot so this would not be an issue. The kitchen is large and has LOTS of counterspace. The living room gets great natural lighting! The room is 12x12 with a spacious closet and a window. It would rent for 750, unless you are a couple then it would be 800.

About me:
Me: I work at a local health food store called New Seasons Market as the Floral Department Manager, have a solid steady income, and always get free food! I'm a vegan, not a crazy one (I eat eggs sometimes from super happy chickens from a friend's yard) and I love to cook and bake and am open to all eating habits. Things that make me happy include, but are not limited to, plants n flowers, cats, baby animals, good food and good cider, biking hiking and camping, as well as photography and different forms of art makin. I'm originally from southern california, but have lived in portland for 5 years and love love LOVE it! I also snowboard and skateboard frequently so am pretty much always going on adventures of all sorts. I am clean and tidy, but not a neat freak or anything like that. I'm not ultra social as in i keep my friends close but don't really party or anything like that. 420 friendly of course. Also, I like dancing, but who doesn't?

YOU!:
Are employed full time, loving, kind hearted, open to new things, and can keep a clean house. I am by no means a neat freak, but clean the house once or twice a week to keep it tidy. I am open to couples especially, although I'd charge an extra 50 dollars making the room $800 to make up for additional storage space throughout the house as well as sharing the bathroom with an extra person. I would love to have someone in the house who is around my age (in their late 20s or early 30s) who enjoys similar things as me. The house is too small to accommodate children or dogs unfortunately.

Feel free to shoot me an email and we can see if it's a fit! Thanks for reading, and happy hunting!!

title: Questions to ask when doing shared housing. . .
postBody:
As I have had more than my fair share of shared housing situations and have --almost- always had excellent luck, I've been asked by several friends about renting a place and what they should ask the landlord, look for, talk about, etc. While I wrote this for them, I thought the craigslist community might find it useful as well.

When I first posted this a couple people wrote and said I should add a couple of things. Those are also included. Thanks for making the effort to write me.

1. How long have they been doing this? Did they just buy this house, rent the apartment (or have these hard times made them take on a renter) and they don't know the first thing about shared space and letting you do things your way in your own time? Or have they been doing this for years and realize flexibility works wonders? The people who're taking on a renter for the first time are going to be wishing you weren't there because they miss their privacy. Exactly how welcome do you think you'll be? Don't be their guinea pig. Let someone else break them in.

2. Are they charging --you- to do a credit/background check or non-refundable fees? I've recently had people tell me there are people charging a $50 fee to do a "credit and background check". Then they call you up and say they rented the room to someone else. That's a scam -- and, oh, by the way, illegal under ORS 90.295 subsection 7. One guy told me someone tried to get a $100 fee out of him. In the real world they call that larceny. In --my- opinion, non-refundable fees, whether they're cleaning, background, credit check, pet, etc., etc., etc. are just plain crap. And, oh, by the way, cleaning fees paid in advance are also illegal as of 2010 in Oregon (ORS 90.302) Make sure you think about that before you give them any money. And realize if you move out in 3 months because these nickel and dime people are driving you crazy, those fees may be a significant increase in your rent over that time. There are others that charge you if you turn the thermostat above 66 in the winter, $50 extra for internet (Huh? It only --costs- $40/month for the whole freakin' house!), and one ad that tacked on $100/mo. to the $500 rent for kitchen privileges. Um, what? Oh, you're trying to be a rooming house, not a shared living situation. I get it. For the same $$? Yeah, no.

3. Other stuff, like basic compatibility -- you know, the born again vegans living with champion barbecuers from Kansas, bible thumpers w/ practicing priestesses of light, and Bush believers with Obama-nation people; that sort of thing. Someone posting a rental wanted you to be gone frequently, only do 2 loads of laundry per week (could you save them up for a couple of weeks and do several all at once?), "be quiet", no visitors (let alone parties or overnight guests), require you tell them about you FIRST or they wouldn't respond, etc. Clearly reasonableness goes a looonnng way. Look for that in the person you're renting from. You can tell a LOT from what they say and the tone their ad.

4. How big is the house and room and how many people live there? You think it doesn't matter? There are people up here renting an 11x11 room in a 2,100 sq. ft. house with 2 other adults and no pets. There are also people up here renting a 10x10 room (20+% smaller - they say it's large and include the --closet- in those dimensions!!!) with -3- adults one child (and another on the way!), 2 large dogs, and 2 MORE medium sized dogs in a 1,400 sq. ft. house they say is 'spacious' (with 2 baths and one of those is the master. . .) in a neighborhood further away for the same $$. Yeah, really. Seriously, where would you rather live? And, if the person who wrote that ad is reading; 1,400 sq. feet is "large" or "spacious" only in Hong Kong, not Portland. All those "high density" cracker boxes slapped up in Couvtucky or Hillsboro with the 20-somethings buying them and looking for roommates -- if they didn't put the house size (and the room size) in the ad, do you think they're closer to 2,100 or 1,400 sq. ft.? Yup, you're getting the hang of it now. Also, condos, apartments, and townhouses are going to be inherently smaller everywhere (including no storage space for your skis and other gear/clothing) than a full-fledged house. Ever hear of a 2,000+ sq. ft. condo? Me either. Not to mention little or no yard, common walls with your neighbors, etc. So make sure you pay less to be cramped every hour you're home, bumping elbows with your fellow roommates, and hearing noises at all hours due to proximity with other people's snoring, music, dishes, conversations, and just plain living. . .

5. Which brings me to: what's --in- their ad? I've seen recent ads up here that say: "I have room for rent in Hillsboro close to TV Hwy & Fred Meyer. If interested contact me." That's it. No rent amount, phone number, utility costs, room or house/apt. size, how many people in the place, cats, dogs, cable, internet, furnishings, if it's an apartment/house/shack, no nothin'. Nada. The record for brevity is 52 CHARACTERS (with spaces) -- and that included the zip code. WTF??? Do you really want to waste your time prying out the information from someone who's --that- lazy (or stupid)? I mean, really. I've NEVER found these people know what they're doing, really understand shared living, and/or have the IQ points necessary to be good LANDLORDS. But if you want to waste YOUR time, knock yourself out.

6. How much are the utilities, really? With electric and gas rates going up by 10-20% every year, have they accounted for that? I'm not saying people lie, but have they even been in the place long enough to know what the heat is going to be this winter or how hot your room will --really- get in the dog days of summer? And if they do, why didn't they put this in their ad in the first place? Are they merely morons or are they trying to hide something? It's not like they're limited on the number of words (after all, look at this post. . ..) Easy way around that is to ask for a fixed price w/ utilities included for the length of whatever lease you're signing or a maximum $$ limit for the utilities. If they balk, consider. . ..

7. Do they need you in order to pay the rent/mortgage because the payment went up or they lost their job? If they do, you can be sure they're going to be a LOT more uptight about bills, who bought the last roll of toilet paper, and splitting everything --precisely- down the middle. And getting that 5th person squeezed into the house in the "spare" room they said they weren't planning to rent out? When push comes to shove, bet you can figure out what they'll do.

8. Central A/C? Sure, you don't need it --now-. We had 21 days above 90 degrees in 2014 and 24 days in 2009; and slightly less in between those years. How well did you sleep? Just remember, July, August, and September happen (not to mention hot days & nights in between). . .and they're closer than you think. . ..

9. Pictures posted with their ad? C'mon, digital and cell phone cameras are ubiquitous today. They --could've- put dozens of pictures of the place on Craigslist. Heck, if it's an apartment complex, why didn't they put the URL: of the place in the ad? Honestly, if they don't have pictures of the house/apartment, it seems to me they're either lazy, incompetent, have something to hide, or are stunningly incapable of managing the simplest thing. Do you really want to bother with any of those FROM YOUR LANDLORD??

10. Are they --really- "close" to a location or a company? There's some dweeb who claimed he's "close" to Nike and he's on 198th and Farmington road (~15 minutes away), which might be "close" in the Bay area; but not Portland. Then again, that's the closest landmark they had because the place is in BFE. . . ;-)) And while you want to be close to something, you don't want to be --too- close. The screeching max train or bus stop diesel can really interfere with your quiet enjoyment after a hard day. . . Craigslist allows you to put in map coordinates in an ad (and it's pretty easy and automatic to do). So if they didn't do it, again, do you really want to bother with any of this FROM YOUR LANDLORD??

11. Why'd the last person move out? If you don't get a good answer, dig! Did they leave to get married or because this goomba drove them nuts? If it smells like a duck. . ..

12. Which segues nicely into how stable are they? C'mon, most of us have had flakes for roommates at least once. On top of that, 42% of sub-prime and 12% of all mortgages are delinquent. If they move out of the place and leave you on the hook for the ENTIRE rent you get saddled with it. Or they don't pay the mortgage; you just got unceremoniously evicted. And if they have your last month's rent or a security deposit and they scamper off, where do you think your money goes??? Anyway, you know what to look for. 'nuff said.

13. Someone pointed out that if you move in with someone who has pets are you going to be expected to help (or entirely) take care of them? They also pointed out this could be the same scenario with children. One person wrote to say she'd recently moved from a place who's landlord suddenly decided 5 kids under 10 years old should spend the summer. Um, wow. Now that's a change in living situation!

14. Do you --really- want to sign a lease for a YEAR without knowing a person? Why not 6 months or even less? Sure they can raise the rent or kick you out. But crazy people happen, too. And that seems to happen much more often than getting the rent raised. ;-0

15. Do they have real contact info.? It's not hard to put in a phone number or even get a throwaway gmail account. When someone is offering a room for rent it seems like "unidentifiable" is a flag. Sure, sometimes you want to be anonymous, but when you're renting a room; ie selling something; and hiding behind a craigslist remailer with not even a first name, e-mail that's been e x p an d e d dot c.o.m so the spam bots don't catch it, or phone number in words and numbers, somethin' seems either lazy or fishy to me. And you kind of wonder about those same people telling the scammers not to write to them. Ah, guys, do you think the scammers actually read the post? OK, rant off. By the same token, you have some responsibility as well. Send them a real e-mail and some actual content; more than just "is the room still available?" and include your PHONE NUMBER. After all, if you have real interest, give them an easy way to verify you're not a spam bot (yeah, they're getting good) so they can get back to YOU!

16. Someone suggested I add: Has anyone ever died in the house? Not sure I'd want to know. . ..;-)

17. Another someone suggested I add was you want to live some place where the bedrooms are on opposite ends of the house...if not, guess what you might be hearing all night; them tossing and turning on that crappy old mattress. And you thought I was talking about something else, didn't you, pervert. . . ;-) Obviously, there's also alarm clocks, early morning or late night phone calls, TV, stereo, video games, etc. that can easily pierce those paper thin walls between rooms in an apartment complex. Guess distance --does- make the heart grow fonder. . ..

This certainly isn't the last word in what to consider when looking for shared housing. But it's several of the big points I've contended with when I was doing it.

Eyes open and head up and you'll do fine.

Sam

title: Queer & trans vegan family looking to create house: join us?
postBody:
Hello, all~

We are a queer/trans couple with a 16-month-old baby, a boxer-mix dog, and two cats, looking to create an intentional house. Care to join us?

We are in need of someone(s) who is lgbtq friendly, vegan/vegetarian, and is comfortable living with children. If you have kids or a family of your own, that's cool too. Other animals are certainly welcome and we would just want to insure beforehand that all get along. Our pup has a trauma history and can be reactive to other dogs, but also loves to play with them once she feels safe. We would like to maintain a vegetarian kitchen, and hope you consider this a bonus. We also like to use hippie cleaners and keep the common spaces TV free (we are considering getting a projector for movies and archive binges, though!). Banjos and guitars will be played, but not well; other instruments (and talent) welcome. We like to ride bikes, but also use our cars. Gardens are awesome. Sharing/ co-cooking some meals together would also be awesome. We like to drink tea and coffee and will likely host geeky things like board game night! In regards to substances, we can negotiate an arrangement of either a completely sober space or light drinking and private/outside smoking, depending on what you need or prefer. For work, one of us is a midwife/massage therapist/nanny and the other is in landscaping and construction.

We are hoping to find our future housemate(s) and then find a house together. We would love this to be in a walkable neighborhood somewhere in SE or NE, with a fenced backyard for the dog. Our price range is up to 800 for our room (the baby shares our room). We'd prefer the master bedroom if there is one, but that's negotiable.

Alternately, if you already have a space and think we might be a good fit, we're also open to moving into an established space.

Thanks! ~J & K

title: Townhouse Share in NE Portland
postBody:
Hi!
I am looking for a roommate (singular, no couples) to share my town house in NE Portland. I am a 30-something professional, I work from home, am generally neat & quiet and am looking for the same (clean, quiet, responsible, pays bills on time, etc). After reading this, if you are interested, please reply with a bit about yourself and what interests you about sharing my townhouse. Thanks!

The room: 1 bedroom, walk-in closet & en suite bathroom (it's the master bedroom of the house so it's pretty decent sized). It's at the back of the house so you don't hear much street noise, it has west facing windows that look out onto backyards. The bedrooms are on opposite ends of the house, so no shared walls.

The house: 3 beds, 2.5 baths. (as mentioned) in NE Portland, Just off Killingsworth & 3 blocks to Alberta and all its delicious offerings. It was built in 2008 so things are new, insulated and well protected from the elements. There are TONS of windows and all the main areas are flooded with light...when we have sun. Washer/Dryer, dishwasher, central air, a/c (!!) are all present and accounted for. The main floor is bamboo/tile, the upstairs is carpet. There is a 2-car tandem garage, no room for another car in there (there is never a problem parking on the street on the block), but ample room for bicycle, motorcycle and other sundry item storage. There is a small deck & yard, complete with a grill.

The rest of the house is shared, except my bedroom/bathroom and the office on the main floor (I work from home). Me and the potential roommate would be the only two living here, the 3rd bedroom is a tv/hangout/guest room.

I have a cat who is super friendly with people & other cats, but isn't so fond of dogs (yet). I'd prefer no more pets, but am flexible based on the person & the pet.

No smoking or drugs in the house. Smoking outside is fine, so long as it's legal.

Deposit is $1,500 (last months rent + refundable security of $750 - this can be split up over a few months to make it easier, we can discuss if it gets that far). Rent is $750 month and includes garbage and internet, all other utilities (electric, water, gas) will be split 50/50 as they are billed (monthly, except water which is quarterly).
